question: What is the difference between General Member and Life Member?
answer: General Membership is an annual membership that must be renewed every year. According to the organization’s bylaws, the annual fee for General Members is NPR 200. Life Membership, on the other hand, is a one-time membership that remains valid for a lifetime, with a one-time fee of NPR 2,000.

question: What is the process to become a member of NSAE?
answer: To become a member, an individual must meet the eligibility criteria outlined in the association’s bylaws, which generally require holding a Bachelor’s/Master/Phd degree in Agricultural Engineering. Applicants must submit a membership registration form along with the applicable membership fee. Once submitted, the application will be reviewed by NSAE, and membership will be granted upon approval.

question: How can i make payment to NSAE?
answer: NSAE accepts payments through its bank account at the Agricultural Development Bank. The full bank details are available on the Donate page, and payments can be made remotely using this information. Alternatively, you may also visit the NSAE office and make your payment in cash.s its bank account in Agricultural Development Bank which detail is provided in donate page. where you can make the payment remotely. you can also visit the office and make the payment in cash
